Full Job Description
About the Internship

Signify Health is seeking a Summer Intern for its Government Workflows & Tools team. The team is responsible for functionality that allows users to manage and track patients in Signify's Episode Connect product. This role will report to a Software Engineer on the Government Workflows & Tools team.

What will you achieve?

Your role will be focused on executing development of key functionality for our flagship product, Episode Connect. This will require working closely with existing engineers on the team to understand the current architecture, propose potential solutions, and ultimately implement the feature end to end.
Working with a cross functional team of local and abroad engineers, you will gain practical experience using Javascript, Golang, deployment tools (BitBucket and Bamboo), and AWS Cloud Services. Additionally, you will gain experience with the health tech industry.
Depending on your skill set, a successful internship on this project would provide experience in some of the necessary skills needed in an entry level Software Engineer position.

What will you do?

Work with a cross functional team of developers, user experience designers, and product management to understand and solve a business problem
Work in an agile environment to take wireframes from conception to implementation to add key functionality in the Episode Connect platform
Have the opportunity to build on a range of technical skills across the entire application using modern frontend frameworks and AWS serverless backend architecture
Learn general software engineering principles, design patterns, unit testing guidelines, and how to be effective in a team with other engineers and external stakeholders
At the conclusion of the program, you will have the opportunity to present your work to senior leadership

We are looking for someone with:
An in progress BS in Computer Science / Engineering at an accredited University or equivalent professional experience in software engineering
Interest in full stack software development and passion about good development practices such as Test Driven Development (TDD), DevOps methods, and Site Reliability
Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to independently find solutions to a problem
Organizational skills to breakdown a complex issue into a manageable action plan
Highly motivated with a passion for creating great products
Strong analytical and trouble-shooting skills
An interest in learning about healthcare data and technology and how it's applied in a professional setting
Past experience with Javascript, Golang, or AWS is preferred, but not required

Program Perks:
Competitive compensation
Potential opportunity for full-time position following graduation
Mentoring throughout the summer in preparation of Final Presentation
Weekly Lunch & Learns with executives throughout the company
Buddy Program for socializing and guidance throughout the summer
Networking opportunities at all levels of the company

About Us:
Signify Health partners with leading health plans, healthcare providers, biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies, and technology companies to improve the quality of life by providing comprehensive care where and when it's needed most. In addition, Signify Health delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. With an innovative logistics and clinical workflow technology platform, exhaustive data set, and an unparalleled national clinical network, the company provides tech-enabled care services to vulnerable populations within the routine of their daily lives to improve health and quality of life. Signify Health delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide and serves well over one million health plan members each year, providing health risk evaluations, complex care management, outcomes-based pharma services, and specialized medical services in the home and other convenient locations. Signify Health has multiple offices in Texas with additional locations in Connecticut, New York and South Dakota. To learn more, please visit www.signifyhealth.com.

Full Job Description
Join Our Community of Food People!

The US Foods Summer Internship Program provides a forum for students to apply classroom skills and academic training in a real-world business environment. In addition to being assigned business-impacting projects throughout the summer, students will be matched with a manager who will meet with them on a regular basis to provide direction on assignments as well as deliver performance feedback and a mentor who will be available to offer day-to-day guidance and support.

Embracing the organization's core values, the US Foods Summer Internship Program Mission is to TEAM UP to build a supportive learning environment where we TALK STRAIGHT about performance development by delivering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement to deliver SECOND TO NONE program experiences to those students who spend their summers with us.

Interns will also get exposure to US Foods executive leadership; have an opportunity to participate in learning and social events with other interns across business functions; and have an opportunity to deliver an end-of-summer presentation to showcase their accomplishments with key business leaders.

US Foods internships are full-time paid positions (40 hours per week from May - August) with the possibility of transitioning to a full-time position post-graduation dependent on availability and overall performance.

BASIC PURPOSE:
With direct supervision and oversight, the intern position provides exposure and opportunity to investigate a career, gain business knowledge and practical application of application development within the food distribution industry.

US Foods has a number of opportunities that will exercise and develop the intern's skills in front-end and/or back-end web application development. Opportunities include our customer and employee web sites, portal-based internal applications, and mobile applications. The intern will engage in creating APIs that share product information, gather and submit order detail or execute data transformation services in addition to front end development all with the goal of creating an outstanding experience for users while leveraging the latest technologies.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Codes, tests, debug, implements, and documents moderately complex programs.
Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation.
Works with other department members to build programs to meet business needs.
Prepares detailed specifications from which programs are developed and coded. Ensures programs meet standard, technical specifications, and creates appropriate documentation in work assignments.
Gathers information from existing systems, analyzes program and time requirements.
Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs.
Assists support and/or project personnel in resolving program issues.
Works with supervisor to resolve issues and validate programming requirements within their areas of responsibility.
Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs.
Communicates effectively (both written and verbal) with excellent organizational and multi-tasking skills.
Assist and participate in project ideation - from concept to delivery on compelling user experiences that integrate Intel technology and business strategy. Responsibilities could include:
Development and implementation of online web applications - Research on website design best practices.
Wire frames - Design mock ups and interactive prototypes.
Ensure developed applications follow UX defined specifications.

BASIC REQUIREMENTS:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems/Science or related area of study.
Must be enrolled in school during time of internship.
Typically, students currently between their Junior and Senior years or between their 1st and 2nd years of graduate school will be considered for internships.
Coursework or skill in object-oriented programming.
Coursework or skill in Java development.
Database server development experience.
Web application development experience OR hands-on website development experience.
Experience integrating front-end templates with back-end functionality.
Experience with front-end web development languages.

PREFERRED SKILLS:Coursework or experience with:
Requirements gathering, design, implementation, integration and testing; developing database driven sites
Microservice Architecture
JDBC, JMS, Web Services, J2EE, Applet, Servlet, JSP, JSON.
HTML5, CSS3, Angular, JavaScript/jQuery
WebLogic, Tomcat
Docker, Kubernetes
Kafka
Swagger
AWS (API Gateway, WebSocket, Lambda, EC2, S3)
New Relic
Git

Please note: we are not able to provide internships to students that require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status).

Vocera delivers the leading platform for clinical communication and workflow. Our mission is to simplify and improve the lives of healthcare professionals, patients, and families while enabling hospitals to enhance quality of care and operational efficiency and humanize the healthcare experience. description:
Full Job Description
Overview

At Zebra, we're reinventing how businesses operate at the enterprise edge - helping them run faster, smarter, and more connected than ever before.

A dynamic community of builders, doers, and problem solvers, we each play a unique role - shaping new technologies, bringing solutions to market, and partnering with companies on the front line of business. Being a part of Zebra means making your mark as we make digital transformation a reality.

It means growing into a leader at a leading company that makes a distinct difference - because together, we've only just begun.

Build Today. Create Tomorrow.

Join a team of builders, doers, and problem solvers.

Join Zebra.

The purpose of this internship is to prepare college students for entry into the business world by providing a thorough understanding of the various functions of the Zebra Technologies organization. The program is designed to provide you with a full experience so that you can fully envision a career with Zebra. You will be positioned for success with training, exposure to all parts of the business, social activities, a professional mentor relationship and development sessions to help you discover your own performance edge!

Zebra Prescriptive Analytics (ZPA) allows customers to apply analytics and machine learning techniques on big data (Point of Sale and Inventory) to find actionable insights that can reduce fraud or waste within an organization. Our pattern library is used to apply repeatable pattern checking that looks for opportunities to improve the bottom line.

Responsibilities

Projects assigned will depend on the candidate's capabilities and interests. Examples of projects may include:

Microservices architecture. Work through solutions utilizing a combination of services to provide users an overall set of features.
Include API activity mechanism to track a series of micro-service calls.

Migrate features from an older version to the newest version build using Angular and Google cloud.

Application performance

DevOps projects
QA projects
Develop planning, organizational and leadership skills
Increase technology knowledge and skills
Develop team-based work proficiencies
Develop interpersonal skills to connect with day-to-day business contacts through follow up activities

Current enrollment in an undergraduate degree program in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
Must be a rising Junior, rising Senior, or graduating Senior
Must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a permanent basis without requiring sponsorship

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of C#

Intellectual curiosity with a strong desire to learn and grow

Full Job Description
Cedar has built a platform that combines data science and machine learning to connect patients with healthcare providers in a way that helps solve the critical challenges of patient billing and payment. Our technology improves the overall experience of patient billing and engagement, enabling providers to thrive in a rapidly changing environment while helping patients understand the cost of their care.

As we continue to rapidly grow, we are in need of a Full Stack Engineering Intern to join the Pre-Visit Pillar of Engineering. The Pre-Visit Pillar is responsible for building out the pre-visit product as it becomes an established new line of business for Cedar. Building with the pre-visit team involves the following opportunities:

Greenfield development in the newest part or Cedar’s stack, implementing new technologies and frameworks, and establishing new design patterns.
Building out game-changing end-to-end patient engagement features.
Exposure to all areas of the codebase as we build up this use case on top of Cedar’s originally post-visit focused infrastructure.

Cedar’s pre-visit product is in the beta phase of development, so our team regularly engages deeply with our clients and rapidly iterates on product and technical ideas, while still maintaining ownership of the overall vision for the product. We’re seeking people who are excited about innovation in healthcare, have solid technical skills, and are comfortable working with ambiguity.

  • Cedar is committed to a flexible work environment, so this as well as many of our roles are remote friendly.
What we look for in a candidate:
Positive attitude and ability to work in a team environment, collaborating with product, engineering, and leadership to drive the best results
Willingness to learn and be challenged
Encompass Cedar's core values: mission driven, no mediocrity, use good judgement, positivity
Demonstrate a passion for breaking down and understanding complex systems

Preferred qualifications:
Experience building complex web applications
Experience with Javascript and modern frameworks (React, Redux, ES6, etc.)
Experience building and supporting production quality software
Experience with AWS, relational databases, REST APIs, MVC Architecture, and OOP principles
Strong computer science fundamentals
Experience with Python/Django preferred

Responsibilities

Design and build new features for our rapidly evolving pre-visit product.
Work with other Cedar employees to find new product opportunities.
Help us scale the company, the culture, and our products.

What do we offer to the ideal candidate?

Remote optional opportunity
An opportunity to work on a platform that is scaling very rapidly, engaging with millions of patients per year and growing at a rate of 360% YoY as of January 2021
A chance to join a high-growth company at an early stage
The ability to impact the growth of our company, we value all comments and suggestions
Transparency across teams and interaction with multiple departments
Competitive pay
Daily team lunch and unlimited healthy snacks at our NYC office
Potential opportunity to join the team full-time following completion of the internship

Full Job Description
The Information Governance Internship is geared towards current college students who are earning a degree in Information Sciences or other related field that aligns with the skill sets included in this job description. We are also looking for those who have a passion for learning the inside workings of a large utility company within the energy industry.

Job Description/Responsibilities

Working with the business departments on their Total Information Management (TIM) migration activities including the mapping and transposing of those mapping documents via common excel formulas. Creating standard template deliverables (word documents/excel spreadsheets/others) and job aids showing how to use them. You will work with the team to define standard processes and the controls to ensure the high-quality process outputs and effective outcomes. Working with the team to expand the functional footprint of OpenText usage in CMS (see traits). This includes self-guided instruction on the platform and how to configure its functionality.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This posting does not represent a specific position and is posted for the purpose of collecting resumes for students interested in an Information Governance internship opportunity with Consumers Energy. Opportunities could include summer 2021 Internships, fall or spring co-op, part-time year-round co-op, etc.

Due to the nature of this posting, and alignment to the fall recruitment season, applications will be collected from January through March of 2021. Response to your application may be delayed due to the extended application period.

Consumers Energy Employee Referrals

If you are a Consumers Energy employee that would like to refer an applicant to this position, please visit your Workforce Connect home page and utilize the “Refer Friends and Family” section.

For questions please contact E-Recruiting@cmsenergy.com

Requirements/Qualifications

Enrolled and actively pursuing an associates or bachelor's degree in Information Technology from an accredited university as a full time or part time student. A successful candidate should have a GPA of 2.7 or higher.

Some of the basic skills required for the role:
Written and verbal communication skills

Detail oriented

MS Excel experience

Browser savvy (Chrome, Edge and Internet Explorer)

Proficient working with various computer systems that support Graphical User Interface standards

Self-starter

Flexible

The following skills and experience may set you apart from others:

Technical acumen with MS products (Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint)

Finance experience or understanding

Experience utilizing and building reports with excel, PowerBI or other commonly available tools.

The location of the internship may vary depending upon assignment and travel within the State of Michigan may be required. However, during this time of uncertainty, we are committed to ensuring the safety and health of our communities and co-workers. We are using new and innovative ways to interview and onboard new employees remotely at this time. This role could be remote until our leadership team has determined it’s safe to resume work in the office.

Essential Functions

In addition to working alongside full time employees carrying out the internship functions for Consumers Energy, Information Governance Interns will have the option to participate in a number of additional optional events within the program. This includes intern networking events, company tours, and the consistently top-ranked philanthropic event, the Intern Challenge.

Hours and Travel

This position requires the individual to typically work 40 hours per week with 85% of the time spent in the office or specific field locations.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The recommended maximum weight for employees to lift without the aid of other employees or a lifting device is 35 pounds. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Full Job Description
We are seeking motivated undergraduate students for Co-Op and Internship opportunities to work as part of our i-Ready engineering team. Be proud of the impact you will have on 8 million students across the country building educational software for the fastest growing company in the EdTech industry and one of Boston Globe’s Top Places to Work 2014-2019.

Please be aware that given COVID-19, this will likely be a remote position, with the possibility of working from our North Billerica, MA home office if conditions change.

How to apply:
Apply here with your resume and any other docs you want us to see (transcripts, cover letter, etc.)

Sessions available:
6-month Co-Op, June-December 2021 (40 hours per week)

Our philosophy:
We believe that in your time with us as a co-op or intern, you should have the opportunity to accomplish meaningful work, while growing as an engineer. You will be placed on (and become an integral part of) a team comprised of people from many different groups including designers, project managers, etc., and you will also be part of a larger community including your peers of other co-ops and interns. We will work with you to make sure you are gaining the experience and skills you want. You will start off with smaller assignments to understand our tools and processes, and ramp-up to more complicated, larger assignments as you learn and apply. You will be exposed to many different aspects of software engineering, all the while completing meaningful work that moves your team(s) forward.

“A successful term at CA will result in co-ops eventually doing the same work as their experienced teammates and learning applicable technical and business skills aligned as much as possible to their personal goals.” – CA Director of Engineering

Our Commitment to Diversity:
At Curriculum Associates, we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!

What to expect:
Develop features that directly benefit our users: K-12 students and teachers
Ensure code quality through testing (unit, integration, and end-to-end) and reviewing other team members’ code
Work closely with team members in product and design
Take ownership of designing and implementing engineering solutions to enhance our product

Have experience in any of the tech we use (take a peek below – we don’t expect you to know all of it)
Want to make a positive social impact
Have a knack for solving complex problems in efficient and creative ways
Enjoy working on a collaborative team

… but you simply must…

Be an undergraduate student with completion of at least one year in an engineering discipline, computer science, or mathematics or have similar experience – some programming knowledge is required for this position
Graduating 1/1/2022 or later OR enrolled in an educational program (school, code bootcamp, etc.) ending 1/1/2022 or later
Have a 3.0+ GPA (if it’s lower but you think you would be a good fit, please write a few sentences or provide other evidence and upload it as an additional document!)
Be able to work 40 hours a week for the 6-month duration of the co-op June – December 2021 in the ETC
Not have held a full-time position in a software engineering role (we do not consider Internships/Co-Ops as full-time; we love to see previous experience!)
Reside in the United States and be in enrolled in a US program/institution

JavaScript (ES6)
React/Redux
Java
Spring/Hibernate
SQL
AWS
Git

Game Room & Gym Facilities on Site

About Curriculum Associates:
Curriculum Associates is a rapidly growing educational technology and publishing company committed to making classrooms better places for teachers and students. Located near Boston, we are an innovative, collaborative, and mission-driven company that has been recognized as a Boston Globe Top Workplace, Boston Business Journal Best Place to Work, and Software & Information Industry Association CODiE award winner.

We believe that—with the right materials and support—all children have the ability to succeed, and this idea inspires our engineering, product development, and service teams every day. Our award-winning products include both traditional published material and EdTech products such as our cloud-based i-Ready®. Our programs provide flexible resources for teachers and administrators, as well as meaningful assessments and data-driven, differentiated instruction for millions of students.

The US Foods Summer Internship Program provides a forum for students to apply classroom skills and academic training in a real world business environment. Embracing the organization's core values, the US Foods Summer Internship Program Mission is to TEAM UP to build a supportive learning environment where we TALK STRAIGHT about performance development by delivering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement to deliver SECOND TO NONE program experiences to those students who spend their summers with us.

Interns will also get exposure to US Foods executive leadership; have an opportunity to participate in learning and social events with other interns across business functions; and have an opportunity to deliver an end-of-summer presentation to showcase their accomplishments with key business leaders.

US Foods internships are full-time paid positions (40 hours per week from May - August) with the possibility of transitioning to a full-time position post-graduation dependent on availability and overall performance.

position: Onshape Front End/ UI Software Engineer Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Onshape is a next-generation Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) product development platform that helps businesses of all sizes modernize and accelerate their design and manufacturing processes. The cloud-native platform is the only all-in-one system that combines robust computer-aided design (CAD) with powerful data management and collaboration tools. Onshape helps extended design teams work together faster from any location and helps executives make better decisions with real-time business analytics and unprecedented visibility into their company’s operations.

Your Impact
We are looking for Front End/Web Engineers to join our UI team to as a Summer Intern. UI Team is responsible for building state of art web app for mechanical engineers. You will join a team where everyone shares a common interest in end user facing 3D CAD systems. Together we try to find new ways to create a great end experience for all our users at all times.

Your Team
You will be part of the UI Team, which is responsible for designing and developing reusable web components used for delivering 3D CAD functionality. Ui team use latest web technologies like Vue, WebGL and TypeScript to build large scale web app for CAD.

Your Day-to-Day:
You will help the team plan, design and shape responsive web solutions
Bind our front and back end services together and monitor, test and continuously optimize your designs.
Work in an environment that supports your individual learning and growth
Build the user interface (UI) and design language across different platforms

Basic Qualifications:
You are pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or a bootcamp certification in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or a related field of study
You have experience building user-friendly, data-rich JavaScript/HTML/CSS applications
You are proficient in TypeScript, Vue.js or Angular
You follow current and emerging trends of the web platform
You have experience with modern JavaScript coding, testing, debugging and automation techniques

Learn and Grow with Us

PTC is focused on developing the workforce of tomorrow, and we offer a world class internship experience to do just that. Our internship program provides students with hands-on work experience in a fast-paced, dynamic, work environment. As an intern, you will be tasked with several impactful projects that will help you learn and develop in your field. At PTC, we believe that a strong internship program focused on growth and development, will turn the students of today into the highly skilled workforce of tomorrow. Each program has a unique structure, goals, and is designed to do just that.

PTC enables global manufacturers to realize double-digit impact with software solutions that enable them to accelerate product and service innovation, improve operational efficiency, and increase workforce productivity. In combination with an extensive partner network, PTC provides customers flexibility in how its technology can be deployed to drive digital transformation – on premises, in the cloud, or via its pure SaaS platform. At PTC, we don’t just imagine a better world, we enable it.

Full Job Description
Who we are

M1 Finance has created a personal wealth-building platform made for the modern era, uniting personal perspective and automated ease. We seamlessly combine free investing, low cost borrowing and digital checking all in one intuitive, automated Finance Super App, and we're driven by a mission to empower personal financial well-being. We believe that financial well-being is fundamental to overall well-being, and we strive to deliver products that are simpler, smarter, and stronger than those created by our boring, entrenched, and slow-moving competitors in the personal finance industry.

Our clients have already trusted us with over $3 billion of assets; we're currently helping more than 500,000 people grow and manage their wealth with our industry leading automation and tools, and we're adding thousands of new clients every day.

We're looking for passionate people who want to improve and build on what we've created and take responsibility to help others build something meaningful and sustainable for their futures.

We mean it when we say, "M1 is yours to build."

If this sounds interesting to you, read on!

Internship Info

M1 internships last 12 weeks. All internships are paid hourly. In the current climate, our internships will be conducted remotely, like the rest of our team and most of your internship will be done via Zoom. We will supply your equipment and you will have virtual opportunities to network and learn about M1, the finance industry, and the technology industry.

What you'll do

Help coordinate a small effort for product
Work with design to conduct research, gather data, and devise solutions
Learn about writing user stories and breaking down technical work
Shepard a real feature into production

Qualifications

Junior or senior in college
Preferably in a technical or business related major (like computer science, business, marketing)

M1's Commitment to Diversity

M1 is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate different experiences and we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) at all levels of the company. Women, minorities, veterans, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, and individuals with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply. With our three DEI task forces (internal education, recruiting, and community involvement), M1 employees and leaders set aside company time to tackle DEI projects and achieve goals every quarter.

Our Values

Our team embodies our eight core principles and if these principles speak to you – we'd love to talk with you.

Mission Driven: We will passionately apply ourselves to deliver immense value to our customers, knowing if they succeed, so too will the company
Extreme Ownership: We think and act like owners. Our focus is building long-term value, not scoring short-term marks. We own everything in our domain, including the outcome and everything that affects it
Boldness: We want to do things of consequence. Make a difference. We would rather fail at something meaningful than succeed at something trivial
Bias for action: The best way to make progress is to act
Economical: Efficiency is important, and we consider both the costs and benefits to our actions
Team oriented: In working together, we maintain low ego, make everyone feel welcome, assume good intent, trust one another, and seek out different perspectives. We empower our teammates to be at their best.
Challenged, but not overwhelmed: We are curious people who always want to grow. Growth happens outside our comfort zone. We achieve our potential through consistent, manageable growth
Integrity: We do the right thing. When we make mistakes, we own and correct them. We would be proud if our actions are shared with our family, friends, and strangers. Everyone can count on us to act according tour values, beliefs, and principles we state we hold. This trust must never be broken.

Full Job Description
Job Description

ENSCO’s Applied Technology and Engineering (ATE) Division designs, develops and manufactures precision, high-speed, real-time vehicle and track inspection systems for the national and international railway market. The ATE Division has an opening for a motivated, self-starting Data Science Intern with an interest in a career working in the field of software design, development and testing. This position offers a chance to enhance the educational experience by working in a team of engineers engaged in projects to design and deliver software products for real-time and offline review systems.

Build and develop solution for False Positive rate we are getting from our integrated systems in the filed. The data should be filtered in such a way that the output will be in high quality - ideally zero false detections. In this project we will build filters best in class to eliminate the noise.

Duties will include but are not limited to:
  • Participate in the development of software for new software utilities and products.
  • Work with Python languages
  • Help prepare testing of software
  • Generate Software Release Notes and Installation packages
  • Participate in the testing of systems for validation and verification of design
Qualifications Required (Skills)

Currently pursuing a Computer Science major or equivalent with a minimum of 1-year relevant (academic) experience
Ability to develop on multiple programming languages
Experience developing software in Java, R, SQL and Python
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Good organizational skills
Must be a participant of the Forge program

min 1-3 yrs related exp

Recruiter

Judi VanDerWesthuizen

Benefit Highlights

  • 401(k) Plan with 2.5% dollar-for-dollar company match in first year of employment, and up to 6% company match thereafter
  • Holidays Off

  • Patent awards
  • Technical paper awards for presentations and publications

Division Description

ENSCO’s ATE Division is recognized globally as a leading provider of railway infrastructure inspection technology. Our products and services are provided to governments and railways in more than 12 countries on five continents. ENSCO work helps prevent train derailments and has a significant impact on the protection of human life, the environment and the economy.

Our team of more than 145 staff supports leading-edge technology projects in many exciting areas:
Sensor systems integration: inertial, positioning (GPS/RFID), laser scanners, imaging (line scan, area scan, thermal), ultrasonic, ground penetrating radar, LIDAR
Autonomous deployment of sensors, positioning systems and wireless communications on active rail cars to inspect railways
Machine vision algorithm development to detect conditions traditionally inspected by humans
Enterprise web-based data management systems to display, report and conduct big data analytics

ENSCO’s ATE Division is an exciting place to work and grow with many key benefits for technical staff, including:

“Innovation Fridays:” Staff is given time to create and experiment with new processes, best practices, and technologies in their field.
Involvement in all levels of the design and development process: Significant experience is gained that is not always available at larger companies that typically reserve serious engineering tasks for more seasoned staff.
Direct exposure to customer management, financial management and business development.

Working in ENSCO’s Rail Division provides a means to acquire a wide range of practical skills and experience in a short period of time, work on exciting and ground-breaking technology projects that impact transportation safety and offers domestic and international travel opportunities if desired.

ENSCO provides a stimulating, collaborative, multi-discipline environment with coworkers from diverse technical and cultural backgrounds working together to make the world a safer place. Come join a stable and growing company and experience the reward of seeing the results of your work make a real impact on solving some of the world’s most challenging problems.

Strength in Diversity

ENSCO, Inc. and its wholly owned U.S. subsidiaries are equal opportunity/affirmative action employers, committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic under state or local law.

description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

We are a hardworking and fun-loving global team with open environment. We have lot of domain knowledge and technical experts in the team to learn from. Our SCRUM teams are completely in control of what and how projects are executed. We support flexible hours and a lot of learning opportunities for our newly boarded team members. Every two week we invite speakers from within the team or from other teams to talk about different projects, products, technical designs , etc to keep ourselves up to date.

What you’ll do:
Position title: SAP HXM iXp Intern – Agile Developer

Location: Palo Alto, CA

Expected start date: As soon as possible – with possibility of 1-year extension

In this role, you’ll:
Learn how core HR application work, what tools, technologies, and frameworks are used.
Work on new target architectural projects as decided by the SCRUM team.
Focus on coding, testing, and automating specific product features, being part of the SCRUM team.
Learn about standard cloud application development practices by applying them on real life cases.

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Minimum BS degree in computer science or related field
Gained more than 1 year of experience in application development and automation
Object oriented programming, Database and Java (related technologies)
Logic and solving problems
Designing and executing.
Being supporting and accommodating
Adopting and Improvising
Any automation tool

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

Full Job Description
Description

Work Schedule: 25-27 hours per week Mon-Fri between 8:00am-5:00pm, Limited Term (6-9mo)

Hiring Range: $14.23 - $15.29 per hour.

NATURE OF WORK
As the GIS Intern within the IT Division, the individual will perform a variety of administrative and technical support duties and to assist the GIS staff with:

Learns and explores all aspects of the GIS Division including: updating spatial databases, reading and interpreting site and subdivision plans or documents and updating attribute information in tabular databases.
Assists with maintenance and development of Enterprise Geographic Information System (GIS), including asset inventories, land records.
Creates maps and data for Town staff, Departments and special projects.
Use a Global Positioning System (GPS) receiver to collect utility, address and other infrastructure data.
Collect and enter raw data into the GIS for Town infrastructure using various methods. Manage data and related data structures within various data constructs including Enterprise Geodatabases, Excel, CSV, DWG, etc.
Creates and maintains metadata for District’s GIS layers and documents GIS procedures.
Assists with the creation of applications using ArcGIS Online/Enterprise technology.
Create and modify models and/or scripts to automate GIS-related workflows
Follow QA/QC procedures to verify and update existing data.
Use AutoCAD to view engineering drawings to get detailed information to use for GIS data entry.
Analyze legal descriptions for right-of-way, easements and other surveyed property and maps them utilizing the Public Land Survey System COGO (coordinate geometry).
Individuals in this position will provide exceptional, service-focused, reliable customer service and communication in handling service requests, incidents, and changes. Individuals will work under the general supervision of the GIS Supervisor and in collaboration with the GIS and IT Division Team Members.
Individuals in the position are required to perform work in a manner consistent with and exemplary of the Town’s PRIDE philosophies and the Town’s Equal Opportunity Employment policy.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED
Individuals work under the direct supervision of the IT Manager to carry out assigned duties, functions, roles, and projects in both routine and complex circumstances.

Essential Job Functions

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
The Individual in the IT – GIS Intern role is assigned specific assignments, job duties, scope, authority, responsibility, roles and requirements as determined by the Town, department, division, and pursuant to laws, regulation and practices. Individuals in this position must be able to successfully perform, be responsible for, and/or assist in the fulfillment of many job functions and duties, with or without reasonable accommodation.
The following duties and responsibilities are illustrative of the primary functions of this position and are not intended to be all inclusive:

Assist customers in solving computer-related problems; find alternative solutions if problems cannot be resolved
Provide analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of end user problems.
Recommend and implement corrective solutions, and perform necessary changes and/or updates.
Prioritize and coordinate work with coworkers and with other departments to ensure timely completion of work
Collaborate with and help support other GIS Team Members with workload
Manage service requests, incidents, knowledge base, assets, and configuration items.
Document GIS and related procedures and solutions.
Manage priorities, deadlines, and deliverables of assigned GIS projects or changes.
Communicate project and change status, progress, and issues to GIS Manager, GIS Team, and other stakeholders
Build cyber security knowledge for self, team, and end users
Commit to personal and professional growth of self and support team on growth opportunities
Maintain updated skill sets, in-line with industry best practices

OTHER DUTIES
Depending on organizational need, additional duties may include the following:
Performs research as directed, such as discovering new technology or tools, market research, etc.
Performs related duties as established by law/ordinance or reasonably directed by the Town.
Be involved in special projects that are directly or indirectly related to essential job functions.
Assists other Town departments/divisions, as necessary.

Education, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, technical ideas to technical and non-technical audiences at multiple levels of the organization
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with other employees, vendors, contractors, and the general public
Ability to use independent judgement and discretion in determining & implementing procedures for areas of responsibility
Ability to develop and manage the service relationship with customers as well as with outside agencies and vendors.
Ability to manage multiple assignments within established deadlines.
Knowledge of the theory, principles, trends and/or practices of technology management and cybersecurity, and their application to public sector service delivery.
Experience & knowledge in the following areas: network equipment and network terminology; desktop/server environment; server virtualization / cloud application; IT methodology and best practices.
Knowledge of hardware and software systems used by the Town (or hardware/systems similar to those used by the Town). Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of hardware configuration, and network operating systems, email systems, LAN/WAN systems, and relational database structures; basic understanding of various programming languages used with current computer technology.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND FORMAL TRAINING
High school diploma or GED
Recent graduate of or current student in, a four-year college program with an emphasis in Geographic Information Systems, Geography, Environmental Science, Computer Science or related program
Familiarity with mapping and database software packages, including ESRI’s ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Enterprise, Collector for ArcGIS, and related tools such as Geodatabases.
Familiarity with GPS data collection, GIS standards, terms, principles and mapping
Familiarity with Python programming language and associated programming tools is desirable
Familiarity with Pix4D image processing software desirable

LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES
Must have a current Colorado Driver’s License or the ability to obtain one upon hire, that meets the Town of Windsor’s standards
FAA Part 107 UAS license is desirable

Additional Information

WORKING ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The physical activities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following: climbing, balancing, kneeling, stooping, crawling, reaching, standing, walking, pushing, pulling, lifting, fingering, sitting, grasping, feeling, talking, hearing and repetitive motions.

The physical requirements of this position are considered Light Work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects

The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.

The employee is subject to inside environmental conditions (protection from weather, but not necessarily temperature changes.) but may be occasionally be exposed to outside conditions in the course of regular activities.

The employee is subject to hazards: Includes a variety of physical conditions, such as proximity to moving mechanical parts, moving vehicles, electrical current, working on scaffolding and high places, exposure to high heat or exposure to chemicals.

The employee frequently is in close quarters, crawl spaces, shafts, man holes, small enclosed rooms, small sewage and water line pipes, and other areas which could cause claustrophobia.

The worker is subject to noise: There is sufficient noise to cause the worker to shout in order to be heard above the ambient noise level.

This position is not considered safety sensitive because the individual does not operate a commercial motor vehicle, as a regular function of his/her daily job duties.

Note: This position description is not intended to be an exclusive list of all of the requirements, duties, tasks, roles or responsibilities associated with the position. Nothing in this position description restricts the Town’s ability to assign, reassign or eliminate duties and responsibilities of this job at any time.

The Town of Windsor will make all reasonable accommodations to ensure that people with disabilities have an equal opportunity in employment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The Town is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity. We prohibit unlawful discrimination against applicants or employees on the basis of age 40 and over, race, gender (regardless of gender identity or gender expression), sexual orientation, color, religion, national origin, creed, disability, military status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other status protected by applicable state or federal law.

position: University Relations - Automation Programming Intern - Richardson
description:
Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship is located in Richardson, TX.

What Are Your Responsibilities?

  • Assisting in design and development of new departmental automated tools in a variety of platforms including but not limited to Excel VB, Access Database, SQL, PowerApps, PowerBI and Tableau.
  • Maintain and enhance existing departmental automated tools.
  • Create automated reports including disseminating information from various sources and systems.
  • Create, design, and maintain databases.
  • Analyze reports and provide insights/suggestions.
What Do You Need To Be Successful?

Job Description:
Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for a Software Engineer in Test Intern to join us for the summer. You will join the Quality Assurance team to focus working within an automated QA environment, assisting with testing, and work on highly impactful QA projects. All roles will provide a summer of valuable, hands-on technology experience in a professional environment.

Applied’s internships are full-time, Monday through Friday positions, that run from May to August. Start dates and end dates are determined by both the department and the intern's availability. These internships will be 100% remote and interested applicants must reside in the United States or Canada. Equipment is provided for the internship program.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work side-by-side with other technology professionals that are designing, coding, and testing software applications that revolutionize the global business of insurance
Create new tools and/or processes that impact our employees and clients, making a difference every day
Exposure to professional documentation/design, QA, and development processes
Experience in an Agile Scrum environment
Work within an Agile Scrum team to deliver high technical solutions that provide business value

QUALIFICATIONS FOR THIS JOB

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, CIS, or equivalent
Must be enrolled full-time at the college/university level for the Fall 2021 semester
Basic understanding of any OOP languages (C#, Java, C++, Python, etc.)
Any relevant projects or previous internship experience working with OOP languages a plus
Basic understanding of web development languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Experience working with databases (SQL Server, MySQL, etc.)
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to work with others in a team-oriented environment
Detail-oriented; self-motivated, able to work independently
Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week), Monday through Friday
Internships run from May to August
Ability to work 100% remotely
Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship

WHO WE ARE

LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE- Applied Systems develops the top two Insurance Agency/Broker Management software products in the world. In addition, we also provide innovative mobile apps, Data Analytics, Customer Self-Service, Insurer Connectivity & Rating, eServicing, Benefits Design, and CRM software products. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.
CLOUD SOLUTIONS & PROFESSIONAL SERVICES- We offer cloud solutions, 24x7 technical support, consulting, implementation, and education services.
AWARD WINNING TECHNOLOGY- We have been voted
2020 Company of the Year (Stevie Award)
2020 New Product or Service of the Year- 2 awards (Stevie Award)
2019 Best Cloud-Based Software Solutions Provider in the insurance industry (2019 Corporate Excellence Awards)
2019 Digital Service Provider of the Year (Business Excellence Awards)
2019 Best Broker Software Management House (Insurance Times)
GOOGLE’S INVESTMENT IN APPLIED- Google/CapitalG made a minority investment in Applied that will spur AI, machine learning, and digital marketing innovation in the global insurance industry.
CLIENTS- We provide technology to over 160k users within insurance agencies, brokerages, and carriers throughout the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.
EMPLOYEES- Applied currently has 1,800+ employees across the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.

COMPANY CULTURE & PERKS

JOIN A GREAT TEAM- We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people. We encourage idea sharing, problem solving, and teamwork in our environment.
DIVERSITY MATTERS- We strive to create a positive workplace culture for those of different thinking, backgrounds, experiences, expertise, and individual qualities across our organization. We want the best and the brightest to be a part of a growing culture that embraces a sense of belonging.
RELAXED DRESS CODE- Applied allows for a relaxed dress code where jeans are permitted; we call this “Dress for your Day”.
FUN PARTIES & PERKS- Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer celebrations employee appreciation events, art contests, employee discount programs, and more!
OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT- We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way!
CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY- Our average employee tenure is 9 years.
CULTURE OF RECOGNITION- Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program.
APPLIED CARES- We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program

BENEFITS & REWARDS

BENEFITS FROM DAY ONE- Applied offers Medical, Rx, Dental, Vision, Virtual Doctors’ Appointments, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, Critical Illness, Group Accident, and Wellness Incentives to ensure employees are covered from day one.
FINANCIAL PEACE OF MIND- In addition to wellness benefits, Applied offers traditional and Roth 401k options, with employer match. Accidental Death & Dismemberment, Short and Long Term Disability, and Business Travel Accident insurance are also offered.
WORKLIFE BALANCE- There is more to life than work: that is why Applied offers benefits to help balance your work and home life. We offer competitive paid vacation time, personal/sick time, paid holidays, summer hours, paid parental leave, volunteer time off, and a free day off for your birthday!

TO LEARN MORE

Please visit www.AppliedSystems.com

Applied Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Diversity and Inclusion is a business imperative and is a part of building our brand and reputation. At Applied, we are committed to recruit, develop, retain, and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law.

description:
Full Job Description
GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. The program allows you to alternate three semesters of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school.

The CIPHER-IT-BOPs division seeks co-ops and interns for summer 2021. Our students work in a collaborative environment providing Business Operations support to CIPHER employees with procurement, asset management, shipping and receiving, technical writing, space planning and management, and metrics creation.

The CIPHER (Cybersecurity, Information Protection, and Hardware Evaluation) Laboratory is a leader in developing the technologies that secure, defend, and respond to threats within our country’s information, distribution, and network systems at GTRI. CIPHER provides high-impact solutions to some of today’s most challenging cybersecurity problems for both government and industry, while also developing far-reaching high-risk high-payoff cyber technologies to respond to future threats. Research areas include cyber threats and countermeasures, secure multi-level information sharing, resilient command and control network architectures, reverse engineering, information operations and exploitation, quantum computing, and sensing, and data analytics.

Required Minimum Qualifications
Co-op
Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Logistics & Supply Chain, Operations Management or related field
3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
Must be eligible to be approved by your college/university to participate in a co-op program and register for co-op credit with your university during work terms. The first work term will start in May 2021.
Must be able to complete at least three full-time co-op terms (alternating three terms of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school) prior to graduation

Intern

Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Logistics & Supply Chain, Operations Management or related field
3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
Must commit to a single semester full-time internship. The work term is May 2021 through August 2021.
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas to technical and non-technical team members
Ability to quickly learn new software applications and tools
Interest in IT operations (emphasis on IT Business Operations).
Basic familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite, various types of computer hardware.
Be a team player with a passion for technology, and a desire to grow as an IT professional.

position: Summer Intern - IT Program Management Office
description:
Full Job Description
The UKG IT Executive Program Management Office (PMO) is a service organization created for the specific purpose of delivering on UKG’s Information Technology (IT) 5-year strategic vision via disciplined, performance-based project portfolio management (PPM). The PMO creates a foundation for consistent project success throughout the IT Organization. It also keeps IT and business stakeholder community informed across projects. In this internship, you will:

  • Collaborate across the IT PMO enterprise to identify process improvement opportunities pertaining to the use of information assets to achieve efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Create new and innovative formal and informal processes, tools, or techniques that others can leverage and proactively drive their adoption
  • Identify and write IT related policies, procedures, and plans
  • Identify and document the various skills and training necessary for the various roles across IT
  • Ensure PPM tools align with PMO Processes and the PMO Maturity Model
  • Research and document best practices for the delivery of projects
Qualifications

  • Provide effective research, problem solving, analytical, critical thinking, influencing, relationship management, and presentation skills.
  • Experience in an IT enterprise and / or IT cross-functional role
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Srong focus on collaboration, team building, and customer service
  • Superior organizational and prioritization skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office - Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, MS Project, MS SharePoint
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business administration or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Corporate overview

Here at UKG, Our Purpose Is People. UKG combines the strength and innovation of Ultimate Software and Kronos, uniting two award-winning, employee-centered cultures. Our employees are an extraordinary group of talented, energetic, and innovative people who care about more than just work. We strive to create a culture of belonging and an employee experience that empowers our people. UKG has more than 13,000 employees around the globe and is known for its inclusive workplace culture. Full Job Description
Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.

At Siemens Healthineers, we are passionate about enabling healthcare professionals to deliver high quality patient care, and to do so affordably. A leading global healthcare company, Siemens Healthineers continues to strengthen our portfolio of medical imaging and laboratory diagnostics, while adding new offerings such as managed services, consulting, and healthcare IT services – as well as further technologies in the growing market for therapeutic and molecular diagnostics.

Siemens Healthineers develops innovations that support better patient outcomes with greater efficiencies, giving providers the confidence, they need to meet the clinical, operational and financial challenges of a changing healthcare landscape. Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as a Cybersecurity Intern.

This is a role well suited to an ambitious professional, looking for the next step in their career. As a Cybersecurity Intern, you will be responsible for:

You will collect existing cybersecurity information, implement data transformations and report analysis results
You will investigate cybersecurity topics addressing training needs of the organization, create relevant training material, and present the material to the cybersecurity group
You will automate decision and data collection workflows within the Microsoft Office 365 environments

You have experience in the Microsoft Office 365 environment; experience with Sharepoint and PowerApps is beneficial
You have good programming skills using Python and a familiarity with the R and Go programming languages
You have familiarity with data analytic platforms, such as KNIME or Tableau
You can synthesize information to create compelling presentations and have good presentation skills

Required skills to have for the success of this role

You are currently enrolled in an academic program in Cybersecurity or Computer Science and are a rising senior, Master or PhD level student
Must have a minimum GPA of 3.2 or higher
Must feel comfortable working in a fully virtual environment
Must be local to the Tarrytown, NY office (50 miles or less); relocation/housing stipend will not be provided for this internship
Must have permanent work authorization

Start date: May 2021; 3-month duration.

At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the med-tech industry. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.

Full Job Description
Atlantic Casualty Insurance Company, formed by Strickland Insurance Group (SIG) in 1983 and acquired by Auto-Owners Insurance Group in 2016, maintains an A.M. Best rating of A++(Superior). ACIC has been certified “Great Place to Work” for the last 2 years and for 2020-2021 is ranked 33 on Fortune’s “Best Place To Work” for mid-size companies.

With offices in Goldsboro, NC; Hartford, CT; and Scottsdale, AZ; Richmond, VA; Atlantic Casualty has authority in fifty states including Washington, DC. Atlantic Casualty offers excellent insurance products, state of the art technology, financial strength, and stability.

Atlantic Casualty is currently in growth mode and has added several new positions over the last year. Join us as we continue expanding!

This position will be based in Goldsboro, NC.

Summary:
This is a paid internship in our Goldsboro, NC office. Candidate will spend eight (8) weeks in our Information System Department working with the software application development team.

Become familiar with how an internal IT department works, from interacting with customers, to defining system requirements, completing systems design, through application development, testing, and product implementation.
Making programming changes to existing policy and claim processing systems.
Working with our web-based rate/quote/bind/issuance systems performing software updates as defined by the Business Analyst team.
Will be working with the Business Analyst team to help define program specifications for other application developers.
Assist with testing changes made to the company's systems to ensure compliance with specifications.
Will assist with performing root-cause analysis of problems reported in applications by both internal and external users of the systems.
Work with the Database Services team to learn the data model, tools associated with access data, and to implement database, stored procedure, or function changes

Current rising senior with a concentration in Computer Science / Management Information Systems.
Working knowledge of vb.Net, C# WCF, Visual Studio, SQL, and SQL*Server or Oracle database products, nHibernate and nUnit to name a few.

Please submit unofficial transcript with a resume when applying.

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of instructions in written or diagram form. Reasoning; dealing with problems involving a few variables in standard situations.

position: Intern, JM&A Finance and Insurance Product Development (Remote/Virtual)
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
JM Family Enterprises, Inc. is one of the largest, most innovative and diversified companies in the automotive industry. JM Family has been on Fortune Magazine's Best Companies to Work For for 20 consecutive years. What started with Jim Moran's passion for selling cars continues today with the dedication and hard work of every JM Family associate. Our principal businesses focus on vehicle distribution and processing, finance and insurance, retail vehicle sales, and dealer technology services. At JM Family, our mission is to be the premier provider of quality products and services. We accomplish this mission by adhering to our core values, the three C’s, the I and the A: Consideration, Cooperation, Communication, Innovation, and Accountability.

The JM Family College Internship Program is designed to create an opportunity for college students to have meaningful work experiences that tie to their programs of study. The program is a 10 week paid remote internship. Students must be available to intern from June 7 - August 13, 2021. Students in the program will actively contribute to their team's success, learn about JM Family's company and culture and obtain new skills through learning opportunities and networking events. The individual selected for this internship will be responsible for supporting their department in a variety of functions and will have exposure to activities related to the department's initiatives. The intern will also gain access to professional development opportunities through the internship program. Some of these opportunities include business presentation skills classes, lunch and learns and career readiness workshops.

Job Description:
The individual selected for this internship will be responsible for supporting the JM&A Group Product Development Department. The department supports sales efforts by maintaining and developing F&I products to be sold by our dealer customers. This internship will provide the opportunity to work alongside a team of professionals to assist with such tasks as enhancing the department SharePoint site, process mapping activities utilizing Blueworks Live tool, assist in expanding the capabilities of a department project management tool as well as supporting administrative tasks related to our form creation process. The ideal candidate will be process oriented, resourceful in learning and researching technology, and have a high attention to detail.

Job responsibilities may include:
Learn to navigate SalesConnect, Blueworks Live, Adobe Pro, and other tools and technology
Collaborate with team members to understand and document process activities
Assist with lender filings
Perform form comparisons

#LI-JD1 #LI-REMOTE

Job Requirements:
Must be a minimum of 18 years old at the start of the program (June 7, 2021)
Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
Required to be actively pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree at an accredited college or university
Preferred majors are Computer Science, Process Improvement, Data Science, or Mathematics
Must be actively enrolled as a Junior, Senior, or Graduate student at an accredited college or university

position: University Relations - Infrastructure IT Intern - Waukegan/Chicago
description:
Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship can be located in Waukegan, IL or Chicago, IL.

What Are Your Responsibilities?

This position is responsible for creating and maintaining IT process information, including measuring business objectives to IT process outputs; helping drive conversations with IT and business partners to define process requirements, and create process flows and metrics to measure success for IT Service Management processes. Participate in the creation maintenance, and reporting of one or more ITIL process area metrics, including Event Management, Configuration Management, Knowledge Management, Incident Management, and Problem Management; utilizing analytics to help implement and continually improve processes.

  • Experience with monitoring tools is a plus
  • Prior infrastructure, IT or other related internship or work experience is a plus

At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference. What is the role?

The Information Risk Management internship is designed to give students an opportunity to apply concepts, protocols and tools acquired through course work in the real world by working side-by-side with our information risk professionals. Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical, problem-solving skills, time management, and customer service skills, including ability to be assertive and diplomatic.
